arguments.description:
XforJ combines the elegance of javascript and the power of XSL elements to produce compiled javascript templates. You compose templates in a hybird grammar and compile that down to javascript.\n
Visit http://www.xforj.com for more info.
arguments.title: XforJ A Javascript Template Compiler

argument.name: --input-file
argument.description:
A pre-compiled XforJ template file.\n
When --output-file is specified, this will be the target of your input file.\n
When using ant, supplying destdir without outputfile as attributes will create a target file in the destination directory of the same name as the input file.

argument.name: --output-file
argument.description: The file where the compiled template will be placed.\n This is ignored if --input-file isn't specified.

antproperty.name: destdir
antproperty.description: The output directory for files given by --input-file, or inputfiles(ant). Directory structure is copied from inputfiles.

antproperty.name: srcdir
antproperty.description: The source directory for files found using inputfiles(ant). This argument is required when using nested filesets, in order to preserve directory structure.

anttask.name: inputfiles
anttask.description: The input files to compile.\n When using this option, you must provide both the destdir and srcdir attributes, or this task has no effect.\n Only FileSet elements are allowed.

argument.name: --overwrite
argument.description: Whether or not files should be over-written. If not specified, any attempt to overwrite an existing file will be rejected, and a message displayed to the output.

argument.name: --minify-html
argument.description: When enabled, space is removed before and after all '<>'.

argument.name: --global
argument.description: When enabled, all templates are assigned to the global object. When disabled, a new object is returned from the entire XforJ program. In this scenario, a mechanism such as eval must be used to capture the returned object to gain access to the defined templates.

argument.name: --normalize-space
argument.description: Replace all white space with a single space ' '.

argument.name: --remove-logs
argument.description: Removes any log elements from compilation.

argument.name: --use-external
argument.description: When enabled, the internal functions used by xforj output will not be included. It is then necessary to load a seperate js library. The library can be generated from the terminal by specifying: --create-library true.

argument.name: --output-library
argument.description: Use this option to create the external XforJ library that is needed when specifying --use-external true.\n When this is enabled, XforJ will not perform any compiling.

argument.name: --escape-xss
argument.description:
When enabled, the following characters are escaped when using print statements:
 *)&
 *)'
 *)"
 *)`
 *)<
 *)>
